recommendations.title: ‘Bigorexia’ Is on the Rise. Here’s What Parents Should Know.
recommendations.excerpt: Although it can affect anyone, this lesser-known disorder commonly affects boys and young men.

recommendations.title: 35 Gaslighting Phrases That Experts Say Are Unfairly Belittling Your Emotions
recommendations.excerpt: Recognizing this behavior early can save you from having to overcome emotional trauma later, psychologists explain.

recommendations.title: The Rise and Fall of Emilia Pérez: How Did It All Go So Wrong for the Oscar-Nominated Film and Its Star?
recommendations.excerpt: Less than two weeks ago, the movie was flying high, with 13 Academy Award nods. Then came a social media scandal and a serious backlash.

recommendations.title: The Grammy Awards Put Motherhood in the Spotlight
recommendations.excerpt: Multiple winners, including Beyoncé and Alicia Keys, brought their kids to the 2025 Grammys, and put them front and center. Here’s what that means to moms.

recommendations.title: All the Ways to Take Screenshots on Android
recommendations.excerpt: If you’re new to Android, or your particular Android device, it’s not obvious how to take a screenshot. It is, however, easy to do, once you know how.

recommendations.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Lionel Messi Is Great, but I’m Most Complete
recommendations.excerpt: Cristiano Ronaldo said he respects fans who prefer Lionel Messi, Pelé or Diego Maradona, but that statistics show he’s the most complete player ever.

recommendations.title: The Last Days of American Orange Juice
recommendations.excerpt: Savor every last drop.

recommendations.title: DeWanna Bonner Solidifies Indiana Fever As WNBA Championship Contenders
recommendations.excerpt: A rotation headlined by Caitlin Clark, Kelsey Mitchell, DeWanna Bonner, Natasha Howard, Aliyah Boston, and Lexie Hull propels the Fever into title contention.

recommendations.title: Costs and Access Top Public’s Health Priorities
recommendations.excerpt: Medical costs and access still top Americans’ health concerns by a wide margin, ahead of agenda items like making food and water safer or reducing chronic diseases.

recommendations.title: Trisha Paytas’s Meme Come True
recommendations.excerpt: How the former YouTube troll manifested her dreams of Broadway stardom.

recommendations.title: Why Some Food Additives Banned in Europe Are Still on U.S. Shelves
recommendations.excerpt: Additives like titanium dioxide, potassium bromate, and propylparaben are still in foods sold in the U.S.

recommendations.title: True Life: I’m a “Menu Sleuth”
recommendations.excerpt: Here’s why I love looking at menus before I eat at the restaurant — something I like to call “menu sleuthing.”

recommendations.title: Return of the California Condor
recommendations.excerpt: North America’s largest bird disappeared from the wild in the late 1980s. Reintroduction work in the United States and Mexico has brought this huge vulture back to the skies.

recommendations.title: Too Busy Blurbing Books to Write One
recommendations.excerpt: For the novelist Rebecca Makkai, writing blurbs had become nearly a full-time job. She explains why blurbs matter — and why she’s taking a break.

recommendations.title: 18 of the Most Romantic Movies You Can Stream for Valentine’s Day
recommendations.excerpt: Whether you’re with a special someone or on your own, there’s a movie for you in here.

recommendations.title: Super Bowl Ads Shift to Health and Body Positivity
recommendations.excerpt: Health startup Hims & Hers will run its first this year.

recommendations.title: What If You Threw a Party Tonight?
recommendations.excerpt: ﻿The most enjoyable social gathering is the one you don’t stress out about.

recommendations.title: A Room-by-Room Checklist of All the Things You’re Forgetting to Clean
recommendations.excerpt: When is the last time you emptied your toaster’s crumb tray?

recommendations.title: Families Buy More Sugary Cereal If Advertising Targets Kids, Not Adults
recommendations.excerpt: One of the top sources of added sugar in kids’ diets is in their breakfast bowls. A new study shows that advertising drives sales of high-sugar cereals when it’s aimed directly at kids under 12.

recommendations.title: How a Family of Scammers Made Millions Off Fake 5-Hour Energy
recommendations.excerpt: Counterfeit energy drinks were lightning in a bottle for Adriana and Joseph Shayota, netting them a million dollars a month until the feds closed in. But they had one chance to clear their name: President Donald Trump.

recommendations.title: To Get Anxiety Right, ‘Inside Out 2’ Had to Go to Therapy
recommendations.excerpt: The filmmakers turned to an expert on adolescent stress to make the worrying antagonist more realistic—and not all bad.

recommendations.title: Why Even Physicists Still Don’t Understand Quantum Theory 100 Years On
recommendations.excerpt: Quantum mechanics depicts a counter-intuitive reality in which the act of observation influences what is observed — and few can agree on what that means.

recommendations.title: Why Some Immigrants Want Fewer Immigrants
recommendations.excerpt: Democrats’ struggles to respond to Trump’s immigration policies have some deeper, historical roots.

recommendations.title: Ke Huy Quan Has Nothing but Love for Hollywood
recommendations.excerpt: Former child star reflects on lessons he learned from Steven Spielberg and Harrison Ford, his roles in ‘Indiana Jones’ and ‘The Goonies,’ and more.

recommendations.title: How Andy Reid Became One of the NFL’s Best Coaches Ever
recommendations.excerpt: Reid boasts a résumé that ranks near the top for total wins and playoff victories. His ability to adapt and keep learning is what got him here, former colleagues told NBC News.

recommendations.title: Scientists Are Trying to Reverse the Effects of Climate Change. in Some Arenas, They’re Winning.
recommendations.excerpt: Conservation efforts have lead to sustained—and even increased—biodiversity among threatened species.

recommendations.title: Five Things We’ll Learn Right Away About the LeBron-Luka Lakers
recommendations.excerpt: How will two ball-dominant stars share the court? How much could L.A.’s defense suffer? Chris Herring examines the LeBron-Luka partnership.

recommendations.title: Mourning David Lynch in a City on Fire
recommendations.excerpt: In L.A., the death of the director of “Mulholland Drive” and “Inland Empire” leaves an unfillable void.

recommendations.title: Use This 15-Minute Checklist to Prepare for a Job Interview
recommendations.excerpt: In just a few minutes you can make sure that you’ll nail your first impression.

recommendations.title: Ikigai: A Japanese Concept to Improve Work and Life
recommendations.excerpt: With no direct English translation, it’s a term that embodies the idea of happiness in living. Yukari Mitsuhashi explains.
